title: [Tony Agapitos Home Movie Collection: Reel 5]
other_title: Tony Agapitos Home Movies: Protest March Melbourne

abstract: From a collection of 16mm film of migrant life in Victoria in the 1950s to the 1970s, by Tony Agapitos. This film shows a protest march in Melbourne in the early 1970s, crowds gather at the City Square then march up Swanston Street.
description: Tony Agapitos was a Greek immigrant and film-maker who documented aspects of life in the Greek community in Melbourne during the 1950s to the 1970s. He focused on significant political, social and religious events, including the arrival of Greek ships at Victoria docks, celebrations and dances, protest marches, political meetings and religious occasions. ACMI holds all of the known footage shot by Agapitos. The material comprises approximately three hours of footage and was shot on 16mm and 35mm film.  This short film shows a protest march in Melbourne in the early 1970s, crowds gather at the City Square then march up Swantston Street. Original notes from the creator indicate "3ZZ Protest March".
